title: 108_hr3092
content: The Act titled "Methamphetamine Equipment, Training, Hardware, Material, and Safety Knowledge Grant Act of 2003" establishes a matching grant program for law enforcement training and equipment to combat methamphetamine labs. This program is authorized under Title I of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968. The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance can grant funds to States, local governments, and Indian tribes for providing protective equipment and training to law enforcement officers dealing with methamphetamine clandestine drug labs. Grants must be used for equipment or certified training programs. The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance can grant funds for equipment and training to law enforcement officers dealing with methamphetamine clandestine drug labs. Grants must be used for equipment or certified training programs, with a requirement for matching funds and allocation to small jurisdictions with fewer than 100,000 residents receiving preferential consideration. The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance can grant funds for equipment and training to law enforcement officers dealing with methamphetamine clandestine drug labs. Grants are awarded based on the jurisdiction's need for protective equipment and training, as well as their methamphetamine-related seizures rate. Funds are allocated to qualifying units of local government with fewer than 100,000 residents, with remaining funds going to other qualifying applicants. To apply for a grant under this program, the chief executive of a State, local government, or Indian tribe must submit an application to the Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance. Regulations for the application process will be established within 90 days of the enactment of this program. Definitions related to the program are also provided. The term 'State' refers to each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the US Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Guam, and the Northern Mariana Islands. 'Unit of local government' includes counties, municipalities, towns, villages, and other government units below the state level. 'Indian tribe' has the same meaning as defined in the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. 'Law enforcement officer' encompasses officers, agents, or employees authorized to engage in law enforcement activities. Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 1001(a) of the Act authorizes $25,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2006 for part CC to support the prevention, detection, and investigation of criminal law violations and supervision of criminal offenders.
